Field Detail

trail

public java.util.Stack trail
The stack trail. It is used for keeping track of of variables which should be unbound during backtracking. Other things may be on the stack as well; they are treated as points where backtracking should stop.
See Also:
markTrail
Constructor Detail

Prolog

public Prolog()
Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Main is an interactive Prolog interpreter.

deref

public java.lang.Object deref(java.lang.Object exp)
Follow pointers for bound variables

unify

public boolean unify(java.lang.Object x,
                     java.lang.Object y)
Destructively unify x and y. This means that the variables in x and y are set so that they when x and y are fully dereferenced, they are identical.

setBinding

public void setBinding(Var v,
                       java.lang.Object val)
Push v unto the trail stack, and rebind it to val

undoBindings

public void undoBindings(java.lang.Object tag)
Undo all bindings until tag is reached. If tag is null, then don't undo anything.

markTrail

public java.lang.Object markTrail()
Marks the current location on the trail. Returns the token used to mark the trail

toString

public java.lang.String toString(java.lang.Object o)
Returns the prolog object as a String
